item.title: Most of the commands in my commands.java don't work? *solved*
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

DAn0194:

Maybe he can make an array of the names and than just using titleNames[titleId];

It’s probably already in an array somewhere within his client. If I remember correctly, which I probably don’t, most people added titles via client sided, then used an int (server sided) to assign what is what.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:18, topic:541509”][quote author=DAn0194 link=topic=660379.msg4415778#msg4415778 date=1395834181]

Change this from “.startsWith” to “.equalsIgnoreCase”, remove the other 2 “playerCommand.startsWith(“LSP”) || playerCommand.startsWith(“Lsp”)”

WHAT IN THE FUCK IS THIS! (click it ran outa characters because of it)
Learn a god damn switch statement.

We will continue with your issue once you fix these…

He shouldn’t even use a switch here.
[/quote]
He should use 300 if statements either.
It’d be more suited to put that into a method…[/quote]
Maybe he can make an array of the names and than just using titleNames[titleId];

item.title: Most of the commands in my commands.java don't work? *solved*
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:26, topic:541509”][quote author=ohokay link=topic=660379.msg4415793#msg4415793 date=1395838661]

This is not just this topic, almost every comment is format this, format that. Half the people in this section just want help with their command, not a lesson on efficiency and readable code.

It actually turned out you were wrong, as I suggested in the first place. Adding brackets to the end of the file does not fix these problems so telling him to do so is a complete throw off. No matter what he added to the end of the file he still got the same error.
[/quote]
Okay? Then I was wrong. People can be wrong. It was trial and error with what I was doing.
If you think everyone in this section needs help (since apparently I cannot give any) you can gladly start helping everyone in the section, and I’ll stop.
I try and give help to as much people as possible, and me telling them to format it is just a tip. It gives the code readability so it will be easier to read and fix the problem.[/quote]

Yes but you focus too much on that rather than answering the OP’s actual question.

@OP No problem, keep going with that portforward, it will work.

Read full topic

[quote=“ohokay, post:25, topic:541509”]This is not just this topic, almost every comment is format this, format that. Half the people in this section just want help with their command, not a lesson on efficiency and readable code.

It actually turned out you were wrong, as I suggested in the first place. Adding brackets to the end of the file does not fix these problems so telling him to do so is a complete throw off. No matter what he added to the end of the file he still got the same error.[/quote]
Okay? Then I was wrong. People can be wrong. It was trial and error with what I was doing.
If you think everyone in this section needs help (since apparently I cannot give any) you can gladly start helping everyone in the section, and I’ll stop.
I try and give help to as much people as possible, and me telling them to format it is just a tip. It gives the code readability so it will be easier to read and fix the problem.

item.title: Most of the commands in my commands.java don't work? *solved*
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:24, topic:541509”][quote author=ohokay link=topic=660379.msg4415786#msg4415786 date=1395835418]

You don’t have enough braces in the file. Add one or 2 to the end of the file. If it keeps giving the same error each compile add one more.

Added 1 and it gave me 30 errors, If i put more it goes back to 31 errors…

That’s because what he’s telling you to do is wrong.
[/quote]
I’m saying he should clean the file for a multiple of reasons, one being that it will be easier to read. Two being that after he read all the code, maybe then he would see the error causing his code to not work properly.

Man every single one of your comments is about formatting or about telling people how shit their code is

Most of the time they have bad code from the previous owner. Which is exactly what happened here. I didn’t think OP took to much offense saying that code is bad considering he said isn’t his. And if you did, Cuber, I apologize.

And I usually use an IDE.
But adding a brace at the end is a good way to see where the actual error is.

Your issue was you were missing a brace, I wanted you to add one or 2 until that specific error went away. Because then you could actually see where the brace goes. But of course ohokay had to come in and assume.[/quote]

This is not just this topic, almost every comment is format this, format that. Half the people in this section just want help with their command, not a lesson on efficiency and readable code.

It actually turned out you were wrong, as I suggested in the first place. Adding brackets to the end of the file does not fix these problems so telling him to do so is a complete throw off. No matter what he added to the end of the file he still got the same error.

Read full topic

You don’t have enough braces in the file. Add one or 2 to the end of the file. If it keeps giving the same error each compile add one more.

Added 1 and it gave me 30 errors, If i put more it goes back to 31 errors…
[/quote]

That’s because what he’s telling you to do is wrong.[/quote]
I’m saying he should clean the file for a multiple of reasons, one being that it will be easier to read. Two being that after he read all the code, maybe then he would see the error causing his code to not work properly.

Man every single one of your comments is about formatting or about telling people how shit their code is
Most of the time they have bad code from the previous owner. Which is exactly what happened here. I didn't think OP took to much offense saying that code is bad considering he said isn't his. And if you did, Cuber, I apologize.

And I usually use an IDE.
But adding a brace at the end is a good way to see where the actual error is.

Your issue was you were missing a brace, I wanted you to add one or 2 until that specific error went away. Because then you could actually see where the brace goes. But of course ohokay had to come in and assume.

item.title: Most of the commands in my commands.java don't work? *solved*
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:12, topic:541509”]I didn’t read it, or all of it. But I did format it (so it’s actually fudgeing readable)
http://pastebin.com/fZF0yt6E

Also. 2k lines of commands? CLEAN THAT SHIT UP.
Issue 1:

package server.model.players.packets;
 
import server.Config;
import server.Connection;
import server.Server;
import server.model.players.PlayerSave;
import server.model.players.Player;
import server.model.players.Client;
import server.model.players.PacketType;
import server.model.players.PlayerHandler;
import server.util.Misc;
import server.model.minigames.lottery;
import java.util.Locale;
 
import java.io.*;
 
/**
 * Commands
 **/
public class Commands implements PacketType {
 
        @Override
        public void processPacket(Client c, int packetType, int packetSize) {
                String playerCommand = c.getInStream().readString();
                if (!playerCommand.startsWith("/")) {
                        c.getPA().writeCommandLog(playerCommand);
                }
                /*
                 * if (playerCommand.startsWith("pure") && c.puremaster == 0) { int i =
                 * 0; c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 0);
                 * c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 2); c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000),
                 * 3); c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 4);
                 * c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 6); c.playerXP[3] =
                 * c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5; c.playerLevel[3] =
                 * c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[3]); c.getPA().refreshSkill(3);
                 * c.puremaster = 1; }
                 */
                if (playerCommand.startsWith("report") && playerCommand.length() > 7) {
                        try {
                                BufferedWriter report = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(
                                                "./Data/bans/Reports.txt", true));
                                String Report = playerCommand.substring(7);
                                try {
                                        report.newLine();
                                        report.write(c.playerName + ": " + Report);
                                        c.sendMessage("You have successfully submitted your report.");
                                } finally {
                                        report.close();
                                }
                        } catch (IOException e) {
                                e.printStackTrace();
                        }
                }
 
                if (playerCommand.equals("staffzone") && (c.playerRights >= 1)) {
                        c.getPA().startTeleport(2012, 4751, 0, "modern");
                        c.sendMessage("Welcome to the Staffzone!");
                }
 
                if (playerCommand.equals("chill") && (c.playerRights >= 0)) {
                        c.getPA().startTeleport(2705, 9187, 1, "modern");
                        c.sendMessage("Welcome to Chillzone!");
                }
 
                if (playerCommand.equals("home") && (c.playerRights >= 0)) {
                        c.getPA().startTeleport(3087, 3498, 0, "modern");
                        c.sendMessage(" Home Sweet Home.");
                }
 
                if (playerCommand.equals("train") && (c.playerRights >= 0)) {
                        c.getPA().startTeleport(2683, 3725, 0, "modern");
                        c.sendMessage("You can train here!");
                }
 
                if (playerCommand.equals("lottery")) {
                        c.sendMessage("The Lottery Fund is currently at <col=255>"
                                        + c.lotteryFund + "</col>m.");
                }
 
                if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("collect")) {
                        if (c.playerCollect > 0) {
                                c.sendMessage("You succesfully collected " + c.playerCollect
                                                + " DT's.");
                                c.getItems().addItem(7478, c.playerCollect);
                                c.playerCollect = 0;
                        } else {
                                c.sendMessage("<shad=6071134>You dont have anything to collect.</col>");
                        }
                }
                if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("myshop")) {
                        if (c.absX > 3074 && c.absX < 3107 && c.absY > 3472
                                        && c.absY < 3506) {
                                c.getShops().openPlayerShop(c);
                        } else
                                c.sendMessage("<shad=6081134>You can only view your shops at home.</col>");
                }
 
                if (playerCommand.startsWith("kdr")) {
                        double KDR = ((double) c.KC) / ((double) c.DC);
                        c.forcedChat("My Kill/Death ratio is " + c.KC + "/" + c.DC + "; "
                                        + KDR + ".");
                }
 
                if (playerCommand.startsWith("/") && playerCommand.length() > 1) {
                        if (c.clanId >= 0) {
                                System.out.println(playerCommand);
                                playerCommand = playerCommand.substring(1).toLowerCase(
                                                Locale.ENGLISH);
                                Server.clanChat.playerMessageToClan(c.playerId, playerCommand,
                                                c.clanId);
                        } else {
                                if (c.clanId != -1)
                                        c.clanId = -1;
                                c.sendMessage("You are not in a clan.");
                        }
                        return;
                }
                if (Config.SERVER_DEBUG)
                        Misc.println(c.playerName + " playerCommand: " + playerCommand);
 
                if (c.playerRights >= 0)
                        playerCommands(c, playerCommand);
                if (c.playerRights == 1 || c.playerRights == 2 || c.playerRights == 3)
                        moderatorCommands(c, playerCommand);
                if (c.playerRights == 2 || c.playerRights == 3)
                        administratorCommands(c, playerCommand);
                if (c.playerRights == 3)
                        ownerCommands(c, playerCommand);
                if (c.playerRights == 7)
                        SupportCommands(c, playerCommand);
                if (c.playerRights == 4)
                        DonatorCommands(c, playerCommand);
 
        }

You put commands in the wrong spot. Who ever you got the source from was kind enough to make a method for each rank. You blew that idea out of the water and put em above it.

[code] if (playerCommand.startsWith(“resettask”)) {
c.taskAmount = -1;
c.slayerTask = 0;
}
if (playerCommand.startsWith(“resetdef”)) {
if (c.inWild())
return;
for (int j = 0; j < c.playerEquipment.length; j++) {
if (c.playerEquipment[j] > 0) {
c.sendMessage(“Please take all your armour and weapons off before using this command.”);
return;
}
}
try {
int skill = 1;
int level = 1;
c.playerXP[skill] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(level) + 5;
c.playerLevel[skill] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(
c.playerXP[skill]);
c.getPA().refreshSkill(skill);
} catch (Exception e) {
}
}

            if (playerCommand.startsWith("resethp")) {
                    if (c.inWild())
                            return;
                    for (int j = 0; j < c.playerEquipment.length; j++) {
                            if (c.playerEquipment[j] > 0) {
                                    c.sendMessage("Please take all your armour and weapons off before using this command.");
                                    return;
                            }
                    }
                    try {
                            int skill = 3;
                            int level = 1;
                            c.playerXP[skill] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(level) + 5;
                            c.playerLevel[skill] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(
                                            c.playerXP[skill]);
                            c.getPA().refreshSkill(skill);
                    } catch (Exception e) {
                    }
            }
            if (playerCommand.startsWith("resetatt")) {
                    if (c.inWild())
                            return;
                    for (int j = 0; j < c.playerEquipment.length; j++) {
                            if (c.playerEquipment[j] > 0) {
                                    c.sendMessage("Please take all your armour and weapons off before using this command.");
                                    return;
                            }
                    }
                    try {
                            int skill = 0;
                            int level = 1;
                            c.playerXP[skill] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(level) + 5;
                            c.playerLevel[skill] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(
                                            c.playerXP[skill]);
                            c.getPA().refreshSkill(skill);
                    } catch (Exception e) {
                    }
            }
            if (playerCommand.startsWith("resetstr")) {
                    if (c.inWild())
                            return;
                    for (int j = 0; j < c.playerEquipment.length; j++) {
                            if (c.playerEquipment[j] > 0) {
                                    c.sendMessage("Please take all your armour and weapons off before using this command.");
                                    return;
                            }
                    }
                    try {
                            int skill = 2;
                            int level = 1;
                            c.playerXP[skill] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(level) + 5;
                            c.playerLevel[skill] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(
                                            c.playerXP[skill]);
                            c.getPA().refreshSkill(skill);
                    } catch (Exception e) {
                    }
            }
            if (playerCommand.startsWith("resetrange")) {
                    if (c.inWild())
                            return;
                    for (int j = 0; j < c.playerEquipment.length; j++) {
                            if (c.playerEquipment[j] > 0) {
                                    c.sendMessage("Please take all your armour and weapons off before using this command.");
                                    return;
                            }
                    }
                    try {
                            int skill = 4;
                            int level = 1;
                            c.playerXP[skill] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(level) + 5;
                            c.playerLevel[skill] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(
                                            c.playerXP[skill]);
                            c.getPA().refreshSkill(skill);
                    } catch (Exception e) {
                    }
            }
            if (playerCommand.startsWith("resetpray")) {
                    if (c.inWild())
                            return;
                    for (int j = 0; j < c.playerEquipment.length; j++) {
                            if (c.playerEquipment[j] > 0) {
                                    c.sendMessage("Please take all your armour and weapons off before using this command.");
                                    return;
                            }
                    }
                    try {
                            int skill = 5;
                            int level = 1;
                            c.playerXP[skill] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(level) + 5;
                            c.playerLevel[skill] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(
                                            c.playerXP[skill]);
                            c.getPA().refreshSkill(skill);
                    } catch (Exception e) {
                    }
            }
            if (playerCommand.startsWith("resetmagic")) {
                    if (c.inWild())
                            return;
                    for (int j = 0; j < c.playerEquipment.length; j++) {
                            if (c.playerEquipment[j] > 0) {
                                    c.sendMessage("Please take all your armour and weapons off before using this command.");
                                    return;
                            }
                    }
                    try {
                            int skill = 6;
                            int level = 1;
                            c.playerXP[skill] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(level) + 5;
                            c.playerLevel[skill] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(
                                            c.playerXP[skill]);
                            c.getPA().refreshSkill(skill);
                    } catch (Exception e) {
                    }
            }[/code]

These can be turned into 1 command…

if (playerCommand.startsWith("lsp") || playerCommand.startsWith("LSP") || playerCommand.startsWith("Lsp")) { c.sendMessage("You have <col=1532693>" + c.pkPoints + "</col> EPP."); }
Change this from “.startsWith” to “.equalsIgnoreCase”, remove the other 2 “playerCommand.startsWith(“LSP”) || playerCommand.startsWith(“Lsp”)”

WHAT IN THE FUCK IS THIS! (click it ran outa characters because of it)
Learn a god damn switch statement.

We will continue with your issue once you fix these…[/quote]

Man every single one of your comments is about formatting or about telling people how shit their code is. Get a grip and actually help them. You are, after all, a server helper?

Quit thinking you’re gods gift. People may not have the skills to make their code as efficient as possible, but I’m sure he’s not aiming for that.

@OP, don’t bother with all of the cleaning, it’d be better but not needed. Focus on your command. Try and figure out what’s causing the command to not work. Print some stuff to the console to try and trace where it’s not working. I came across a similar issue a while back and it was because I was using

if (command.equals

It worked with

if (command.startsWith

I’ll gladly help you clean it up a little and sort the problem, send me a message.

Read full topic

item.title: Most of the commands in my commands.java don't work? *solved*
item.dc:creator: @Cuber317 Cuber317
item.description:
@Cuber317 wrote:

Started cleaning the commands.java and got this error when compiling:

src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:808: error: illegal start of expr ession public void moderatorCommands(Client c, String playerCommand) ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:808: error: illegal start of expr ession public void moderatorCommands(Client c, String playerCommand) ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:808: error: ';' expected public void moderatorCommands(Client c, String playerCommand) ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:808: error: ';' expected public void moderatorCommands(Client c, String playerCommand) ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:808: error: not a statement public void moderatorCommands(Client c, String playerCommand) ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:808: error: ';' expected public void moderatorCommands(Client c, String playerCommand) ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:1038: error: illegal start of exp ression public void administratorCommands(Client c, String playerCommand) ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:1038: error: illegal start of exp ression public void administratorCommands(Client c, String playerCommand) ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:1038: error: ';' expected public void administratorCommands(Client c, String playerCommand) ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:1038: error: ';' expected public void administratorCommands(Client c, String playerCommand) ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:1038: error: not a statement public void administratorCommands(Client c, String playerCommand) ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:1038: error: ';' expected public void administratorCommands(Client c, String playerCommand) ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:1167: error: illegal start of exp ression public void ownerCommands(Client c, String playerCommand) ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:1167: error: illegal start of exp ression public void ownerCommands(Client c, String playerCommand) ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:1167: error: ';' expected public void ownerCommands(Client c, String playerCommand) ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:1167: error: ';' expected public void ownerCommands(Client c, String playerCommand) ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:1167: error: not a statement public void ownerCommands(Client c, String playerCommand) ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:1167: error: ';' expected public void ownerCommands(Client c, String playerCommand) ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:1757: error: illegal start of exp ression public void SupportCommands(Client c, String playerCommand) ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:1757: error: illegal start of exp ression public void SupportCommands(Client c, String playerCommand) ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:1757: error: ';' expected public void SupportCommands(Client c, String playerCommand) ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:1757: error: ';' expected public void SupportCommands(Client c, String playerCommand) ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:1757: error: not a statement public void SupportCommands(Client c, String playerCommand) ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:1757: error: ';' expected public void SupportCommands(Client c, String playerCommand) ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:1780: error: illegal start of exp ression public void DonatorCommands(Client c, String playerCommand) ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:1780: error: illegal start of exp ression public void DonatorCommands(Client c, String playerCommand) ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:1780: error: ';' expected public void DonatorCommands(Client c, String playerCommand) ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:1780: error: ';' expected public void DonatorCommands(Client c, String playerCommand) ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:1780: error: not a statement public void DonatorCommands(Client c, String playerCommand) ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:1780: error: ';' expected public void DonatorCommands(Client c, String playerCommand) ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:1856: error: reached end of file while parsing } ^ 31 errors Compile Finished! Jatka painamalla mitä tahansa näppäintä . . .

I know it’s not hard to fix but i’m new to java and can’t figure whats wrong with the public void thing…

item.title: Most of the commands in my commands.java don't work? *solved*
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

I didn’t read it, or all of it. But I did format it (so it’s actually fucking readable)
http://pastebin.com/fZF0yt6E

Also. 2k lines of commands? CLEAN THAT SHIT UP.
Issue 1:

package server.model.players.packets;
 
import server.Config;
import server.Connection;
import server.Server;
import server.model.players.PlayerSave;
import server.model.players.Player;
import server.model.players.Client;
import server.model.players.PacketType;
import server.model.players.PlayerHandler;
import server.util.Misc;
import server.model.minigames.lottery;
import java.util.Locale;
 
import java.io.*;
 
/**
 * Commands
 **/
public class Commands implements PacketType {
 
        @Override
        public void processPacket(Client c, int packetType, int packetSize) {
                String playerCommand = c.getInStream().readString();
                if (!playerCommand.startsWith("/")) {
                        c.getPA().writeCommandLog(playerCommand);
                }
                /*
                 * if (playerCommand.startsWith("pure") && c.puremaster == 0) { int i =
                 * 0; c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 0);
                 * c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 2); c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000),
                 * 3); c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 4);
                 * c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 6); c.playerXP[3] =
                 * c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5; c.playerLevel[3] =
                 * c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[3]); c.getPA().refreshSkill(3);
                 * c.puremaster = 1; }
                 */
                if (playerCommand.startsWith("report") && playerCommand.length() > 7) {
                        try {
                                BufferedWriter report = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(
                                                "./Data/bans/Reports.txt", true));
                                String Report = playerCommand.substring(7);
                                try {
                                        report.newLine();
                                        report.write(c.playerName + ": " + Report);
                                        c.sendMessage("You have successfully submitted your report.");
                                } finally {
                                        report.close();
                                }
                        } catch (IOException e) {
                                e.printStackTrace();
                        }
                }
 
                if (playerCommand.equals("staffzone") && (c.playerRights >= 1)) {
                        c.getPA().startTeleport(2012, 4751, 0, "modern");
                        c.sendMessage("Welcome to the Staffzone!");
                }
 
                if (playerCommand.equals("chill") && (c.playerRights >= 0)) {
                        c.getPA().startTeleport(2705, 9187, 1, "modern");
                        c.sendMessage("Welcome to Chillzone!");
                }
 
                if (playerCommand.equals("home") && (c.playerRights >= 0)) {
                        c.getPA().startTeleport(3087, 3498, 0, "modern");
                        c.sendMessage(" Home Sweet Home.");
                }
 
                if (playerCommand.equals("train") && (c.playerRights >= 0)) {
                        c.getPA().startTeleport(2683, 3725, 0, "modern");
                        c.sendMessage("You can train here!");
                }
 
                if (playerCommand.equals("lottery")) {
                        c.sendMessage("The Lottery Fund is currently at <col=255>"
                                        + c.lotteryFund + "</col>m.");
                }
 
                if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("collect")) {
                        if (c.playerCollect > 0) {
                                c.sendMessage("You succesfully collected " + c.playerCollect
                                                + " DT's.");
                                c.getItems().addItem(7478, c.playerCollect);
                                c.playerCollect = 0;
                        } else {
                                c.sendMessage("<shad=6071134>You dont have anything to collect.</col>");
                        }
                }
                if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("myshop")) {
                        if (c.absX > 3074 && c.absX < 3107 && c.absY > 3472
                                        && c.absY < 3506) {
                                c.getShops().openPlayerShop(c);
                        } else
                                c.sendMessage("<shad=6081134>You can only view your shops at home.</col>");
                }
 
                if (playerCommand.startsWith("kdr")) {
                        double KDR = ((double) c.KC) / ((double) c.DC);
                        c.forcedChat("My Kill/Death ratio is " + c.KC + "/" + c.DC + "; "
                                        + KDR + ".");
                }
 
                if (playerCommand.startsWith("/") && playerCommand.length() > 1) {
                        if (c.clanId >= 0) {
                                System.out.println(playerCommand);
                                playerCommand = playerCommand.substring(1).toLowerCase(
                                                Locale.ENGLISH);
                                Server.clanChat.playerMessageToClan(c.playerId, playerCommand,
                                                c.clanId);
                        } else {
                                if (c.clanId != -1)
                                        c.clanId = -1;
                                c.sendMessage("You are not in a clan.");
                        }
                        return;
                }
                if (Config.SERVER_DEBUG)
                        Misc.println(c.playerName + " playerCommand: " + playerCommand);
 
                if (c.playerRights >= 0)
                        playerCommands(c, playerCommand);
                if (c.playerRights == 1 || c.playerRights == 2 || c.playerRights == 3)
                        moderatorCommands(c, playerCommand);
                if (c.playerRights == 2 || c.playerRights == 3)
                        administratorCommands(c, playerCommand);
                if (c.playerRights == 3)
                        ownerCommands(c, playerCommand);
                if (c.playerRights == 7)
                        SupportCommands(c, playerCommand);
                if (c.playerRights == 4)
                        DonatorCommands(c, playerCommand);
 
        }

You put commands in the wrong spot. Who ever you got the source from was kind enough to make a method for each rank. You blew that idea out of the water and put em above it.

[code] if (playerCommand.startsWith(“resettask”)) {
c.taskAmount = -1;
c.slayerTask = 0;
}
if (playerCommand.startsWith(“resetdef”)) {
if (c.inWild())
return;
for (int j = 0; j < c.playerEquipment.length; j++) {
if (c.playerEquipment[j] > 0) {
c.sendMessage(“Please take all your armour and weapons off before using this command.”);
return;
}
}
try {
int skill = 1;
int level = 1;
c.playerXP[skill] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(level) + 5;
c.playerLevel[skill] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(
c.playerXP[skill]);
c.getPA().refreshSkill(skill);
} catch (Exception e) {
}
}

            if (playerCommand.startsWith("resethp")) {
                    if (c.inWild())
                            return;
                    for (int j = 0; j < c.playerEquipment.length; j++) {
                            if (c.playerEquipment[j] > 0) {
                                    c.sendMessage("Please take all your armour and weapons off before using this command.");
                                    return;
                            }
                    }
                    try {
                            int skill = 3;
                            int level = 1;
                            c.playerXP[skill] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(level) + 5;
                            c.playerLevel[skill] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(
                                            c.playerXP[skill]);
                            c.getPA().refreshSkill(skill);
                    } catch (Exception e) {
                    }
            }
            if (playerCommand.startsWith("resetatt")) {
                    if (c.inWild())
                            return;
                    for (int j = 0; j < c.playerEquipment.length; j++) {
                            if (c.playerEquipment[j] > 0) {
                                    c.sendMessage("Please take all your armour and weapons off before using this command.");
                                    return;
                            }
                    }
                    try {
                            int skill = 0;
                            int level = 1;
                            c.playerXP[skill] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(level) + 5;
                            c.playerLevel[skill] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(
                                            c.playerXP[skill]);
                            c.getPA().refreshSkill(skill);
                    } catch (Exception e) {
                    }
            }
            if (playerCommand.startsWith("resetstr")) {
                    if (c.inWild())
                            return;
                    for (int j = 0; j < c.playerEquipment.length; j++) {
                            if (c.playerEquipment[j] > 0) {
                                    c.sendMessage("Please take all your armour and weapons off before using this command.");
                                    return;
                            }
                    }
                    try {
                            int skill = 2;
                            int level = 1;
                            c.playerXP[skill] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(level) + 5;
                            c.playerLevel[skill] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(
                                            c.playerXP[skill]);
                            c.getPA().refreshSkill(skill);
                    } catch (Exception e) {
                    }
            }
            if (playerCommand.startsWith("resetrange")) {
                    if (c.inWild())
                            return;
                    for (int j = 0; j < c.playerEquipment.length; j++) {
                            if (c.playerEquipment[j] > 0) {
                                    c.sendMessage("Please take all your armour and weapons off before using this command.");
                                    return;
                            }
                    }
                    try {
                            int skill = 4;
                            int level = 1;
                            c.playerXP[skill] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(level) + 5;
                            c.playerLevel[skill] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(
                                            c.playerXP[skill]);
                            c.getPA().refreshSkill(skill);
                    } catch (Exception e) {
                    }
            }
            if (playerCommand.startsWith("resetpray")) {
                    if (c.inWild())
                            return;
                    for (int j = 0; j < c.playerEquipment.length; j++) {
                            if (c.playerEquipment[j] > 0) {
                                    c.sendMessage("Please take all your armour and weapons off before using this command.");
                                    return;
                            }
                    }
                    try {
                            int skill = 5;
                            int level = 1;
                            c.playerXP[skill] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(level) + 5;
                            c.playerLevel[skill] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(
                                            c.playerXP[skill]);
                            c.getPA().refreshSkill(skill);
                    } catch (Exception e) {
                    }
            }
            if (playerCommand.startsWith("resetmagic")) {
                    if (c.inWild())
                            return;
                    for (int j = 0; j < c.playerEquipment.length; j++) {
                            if (c.playerEquipment[j] > 0) {
                                    c.sendMessage("Please take all your armour and weapons off before using this command.");
                                    return;
                            }
                    }
                    try {
                            int skill = 6;
                            int level = 1;
                            c.playerXP[skill] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(level) + 5;
                            c.playerLevel[skill] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(
                                            c.playerXP[skill]);
                            c.getPA().refreshSkill(skill);
                    } catch (Exception e) {
                    }
            }[/code]

These can be turned into 1 command…

if (playerCommand.startsWith("lsp") || playerCommand.startsWith("LSP") || playerCommand.startsWith("Lsp")) { c.sendMessage("You have <col=1532693>" + c.pkPoints + "</col> EPP."); }
Change this from “.startsWith” to “.equalsIgnoreCase”, remove the other 2 “playerCommand.startsWith(“LSP”) || playerCommand.startsWith(“Lsp”)”

WHAT IN THE FUCK IS THIS! (click it ran outa characters because of it)
Learn a god damn switch statement.

We will continue with your issue once you fix these…

item.dc:creator: @Bl3nd Bl3nd
item.description:
@Bl3nd wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:9, topic:541509”][quote author=Bl3nd link=topic=660379.msg4415647#msg4415647 date=1395784684]

Unless you put a thing that checks the rights of the player required to do the command. Preferably in the “if” statement

Or he could just leave the check he already has in, making it so only his username can use it…

@Cuber post your whole commands file.

Yes, but he said he was maybe going to delete that part. So I gave him another way to make sure only certain people can use the command…

Yeah i knew that, My username is jage, But also. if i’d just remove it , it would be so everyone could use the command. right?

[/quote]
He didn’t say he was going to, he asked a question lol.[/quote]
I saw it as a situation that he was maybe going to remove it. To answer his question then, if he did remove it then yes any player could use that command.
